Posts.Content: Hi - I'm sorry to hear about your side effects.  I had problems with Armidex as well.  I had trouble sleeping (vibrating body when I laid down), joints ached and developed "trigger finger" in my left hand.  I talked to my dr about it and decided to take my chances and stop taking it.  My BC was stage 1, ten years ago, estrogen negative.  She felt like the pros of taking it were not greater than the side effects I was having.  It has taken about 2 months for my body to feel normal again (except the trigger finger is still there) but I'm glad I made that decision.  IF my BC was definitely being held at bay because of it, I would have continued.  But since my Dr felt it wasn't making a significant contribution to my health, I quit.  Talk about it more with your Dr...there are other drugs out there.
Posts.Title: Side effects of Aromasin and Armidex

Posts.Content: On 1/9/2008 donnalynn wrote: I am also becoming a little discouraged after being on the Aimidex for almost a year.  I was doing okay, some joint and bone pain, but I could deal with it. But now I am struggling. Lots of bone and joint pain, depression, not sleeping at night, etc. Is this going to continue to get worse?  I have no energy, feel like I am 80 years old. I go to work and all I can think about is getting home and going to bed. Do any of you have tingling and numbness in your arms or legs.  This only happens when I am lying down and it is hard to sleep.  Called my doctor and asked about this and was told that it could not be a side effect of Arimidex, but it makes me wonder.   Finally!  Someone else has written what I am feeling on Arimidex.  I thought I was going crazy or my brain was melting.  I, too, have tingling, vibrating feelings at night when I lay down to go to sleep.  And that is when I take my Arimidex.  I am going to call my dr and see if I can take it another time of day.  I have never seen it written anywhere as a side effect of the drug.  My hands also feel swollen although they don't particularly look swollen.  I guess I have to decide if these bother me enough to quit taking the drug.  My BC was 10 years ago (I've already had 5 years of Tamoxifen), Stage 1, node negative, not Estrogen Receptive, Progestrogen Receptive.  I'm not even sure if this drug is going to be that productive for me.
Posts.Title: Side Effects - Arimidex

Posts.Content: On 1/9/2008 donnalynn wrote: I am also becoming a little discouraged after being on the Aimidex for almost a year.  I was doing okay, some joint and bone pain, but I could deal with it. But now I am struggling. Lots of bone and joint pain, depression, not sleeping at night, etc. Is this going to continue to get worse?  I have no energy, feel like I am 80 years old. Do any of you have tingling and numbness in your arms or legs.  This only happens when I am lying down and it is hard to sleep.  Called my doctor and asked about this and was told that it could not be a side effect of Arimidex, but it makes me wonder.   Finally!  Someone else has written what I am feeling on Arimidex.  I thought I was going crazy or my brain was melting.  I, too, have tingling, vibrating feelings at night when I lay down to go to sleep.  And that is when I take my Arimidex.  I am going to call my dr and see if I can take it another time of day.  I have never seen it written anywhere as a side effect of the drug.  My hands also feel swollen although they don't particularly look swollen.  I guess I have to decide if these bother me enough to quit taking the drug.  My BC was 10 years ago (I've already had 5 years of Tamoxifen), Stage 1, node negative, not Estrogen Receptive, Progestrogen Receptive.  I'm not even sure if this drug is going to be that productive for me.
Posts.Title: Side Effects - Arimidex

Posts.Content: Hi,  I took Arimidex for several months and started having the numbness, then tingling in my fingers and toes..finally felt like I was vibrating every time I laid down at night.  It's a very odd side effect.  My dr took me off of it, but my symptoms have remained almost a year later.  I'm still not used to it...creeps me out.  I have found that caffeine amplifies the side effects so steer clear of it late in the day.
Posts.Title: side effects

Posts.Content: I was diagnoised in 1998 (age 42) and have been "cancer free" since.  I don't know if I'll ever consider myself cured but it sure feels good to get the all clear every year.  :)  Hang in there...be viligent in your healthcare and enjoy your life.
Posts.Title: triple negative breast cancer
